g6kh87K9UfNqhMRK_Q6bUQ.text: A friend told us about this place from NYC so decided to give it a go.  It's kind of like an Indian wrap/dosa, with vegetarian or meat fillings.  It is quite filling so a good option for a quick lunch.  I got the spicy lamb filling, very tasty although my raw skills at kati roll eating wasnt very good and it got a bit messy in the end when the roll got deconstructed.  Service is fast and the place has a decent sized seating area so good for a quick sit-down lunch.  I also had the chai latte, which came as a bland mixture of tea and milk, do NOT get that. Just the roll.

ceV4rYbfmcTXtdaf4-S68g.text: Lovely place ... As far as my very much middle eastern taste is concerned ... This place solves a great issue with Indian food in london ... The chutney isn't sweet! Which is great! On the downside the place reeks of spices and onions ... The kitchen is clean and all but less exposure to it would be great ..

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom

VOAASRiNJmdyhGKdrLyd-w.text: Oh Kati Roll, I had such high hopes - maybe a bit too high.  I had passed their New York branch multiple times, but did not decide to try Kati Roll until I spent time in London.  Kati Roll Company serves Indian-style wraps with a variety of fillings.  On this occasion, I decided to have the aloo masala, a vegetarian option of potatoes, spices, and other vegetables.  The restaurant itself had decent seating with colorful murals on the walls.  My biggest complain with Kati Roll was that the service was exceptionally slow - there seemed to be more people waiting for food rather than eating.  I'm not sure if it was understaffed or the Friday lunch-"rush" (there were probably a dozen people), but I expected faster service for a restaurant where most of the orders seemed to be take-away.  The food itself was somewhat redeeming: my aloo masala wrap had a nice blend of spices, but the filling-to-paratha (bread) was very sad, and I only got a smattering of onions and tomatoes.  For the cost, I believe the roll was a bit small, but hey, this is London, and everything is expensive. Perhaps I will have a better experience at the New York branch of Kati Roll Company.

QZ53TT9fetoiDKV2_QCskQ.text: It's an Indian Burrito! Well sorta but I love burritos so I'm going to go with that. It's definitely something different and marries the flavours I grew up with the form of food I've grown to love.For the price, it's great value and if you order 2 you get an even better deal. I'd recommend ordering 2 and keeping 1 for later if you are on your own. Size-wise, they aren' much bigger than a wrap from Pret, so you could probably knock out two for lunch without too much grumbling.It's a great quick place to pop into for lunch when wandering around Soho and it's just up the street from some markets so that makes it even better!

7nhxZztxlJfIabAJ0e0iTw.text: The food was tasty and suprisingly good. I hope it was not their food that makes me sick in the evening. It shouldn't, coz' it was really good.

Bn1bdxqU8F4qMpee8-Uqsg.text: Mmm great place for a post-committee meeting nom. Or any time, just go! They're great value for money, decent service, and super tasty. I've only had the chicken tikka roll at my friend's recommendation but it's fantastic and nicely spiced. I would DEFINITELY try more from them next time, especially since there's deals when you buy 2. When I went there it was really quiet so we got our food fairly quickly though I imagine as it got busier it'd be a bit slower, but totally worth it!

1fjkCemuOwB7UC8xdDFmpg.text: This incredibly orange shop is my new favourite Indian place in London. That does seem like quite a bold statement, but it really is an exciting option for lunch. The reason it is so exciting is not just because of its excentric orange paint job, but also the fact that Indian food in a roll is just delicious.As I had never heard of the place before, I asked the man in the shop a little bit about it. He told me that it started in New York and now there is a store in London. It definitely has a bit of a New York vibe about it as well.There is a selection of chicken, beef and vege rolls on offer. I went for 2 beef tikka rolls, which cost 6 pounds. It was definitely a good choice, and I am keen to go through the whole menu, as I get the feeling they would all be good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom

ASCqq1r4vx2alJq5B2_Jpw.text: Amazing chicken and mutton Kathi rolls! Just wished they had better delivery options!

mBwp6xuFPZ8CjBk7ntrUvA.text: Oh my goodness.  Good cheap food!  My husband and I really enjoyed this place.  You can find both vegetarian and meat options, which is nice for a mixed crowd.  The guy at the counter was nice, too.  We really enjoyed our food.  Being a Texan, I wanted to call them "burritos".  "Wrap" is probably a more correct term, though.  If we lived in London, I can guarantee that my husband and I would eat here quite frequently.  Oh, and Bollywood posters were awesome, too.  :)

JncACeesXMc1y-F3nNiGyA.text: The rule: Friends Don't Let Other Friends Eat Wrapsthe list of current exceptions:1. Burritos - once you add beans and rice you're safe2. Shwarma & Falafel - the middle east gets an exceptionand now...3. Kati RollsBecause wrapping your aloo tikka or paneer in a flaky paratha is a million times more acceptable than wrapping your tuna salad in a limp pitta or tortilla. The textures are wonderful, every bite is delicious and when you're done the swipe of your mouth with a tissue reveals a sneaky oily residue. Could it be ghee? Ghee makes everything amazing.

GNQE0mXgx5LcvQEeBMFMPg.text: Lovely stuff wrapped up in paratha.  I'm a big fan of the kofte rolls you really do need two and by all rights they should be cheaper, but hey-ho, its the West End, what do you expect?

xb0aowau-1g1_FUDbVgWkQ.text: Affordable, tasty, original, great atmosphere. All adds up for one of the best quick bites in London. They do need more seating, however, you're usually caught up waiting for a seat for the first ten minutes.

npnznQ0WwddweLdXYiY9Hg.text: Amazin Shami kebab roll. It is as close as you can get to the taste of an authentic  shami kebab!

-tSYAK0CBHZBFKTpkQpyPQ.text: We were walking around the city after doing a bit of shopping, and were on our way to the British Museum.  I look down a side street and see a sign for Kati Roll.  My eyes quickly widen.  Is this the same Kati Roll from New York that I absolutely love?  I walk to the entrance, and yes it is!  I had no idea they had a location in London.  My brother-in-law and I both get excited, and despite having just eaten lunch, we grabbed a couple of rolls.  This place is excellent- and you can't go wrong with the paneer or chicken options.  Prices are very reasonable as well.

7dldJnYJjVI0admqJGMPiA.text: I would call these delicious wraps 'Indian Food Burritos,' but I am not very cultured. Apparently they are common Indian street food, but I have never been on an Indian street, so I wouldn't know for sure. In any case, these things are mega-delicious.They take a long time to make, but that means they always  taste fresh and hot. There are little bits of veggies and onions in there, but these things are mostly meat (yummy, spicy, tender meat- unless you get egg or potato, which are not meat). The roti-type wrap beats the hell out of tortillas, and I love tortillas, so that means a lot.Be warned, however, that if you get them for takeaway, they will stink up your entire office.

rlxky6M1DnhRhNSQHPEHpA.text: For the price you pay - you couldn't ask for more. Juicy, spicy authentic Indian meat-filled rolls! I recommend the "anda shammi kebab" roll. The decor is quirky with old bollywood film posters. Staff are just there to take your order and call out your number - don't expect anything extra. Affordable and totally recommended for a quick bite!

Qi6LQ0k_-5NxVDSVmQVH5A.text: Just go here for spicy greasy indian street food :)I ate at the NY one so I was pretty excited that London had this.  You need to have a branch in Santa Monica!!!  I liked the usual Paneer and Aloo Roll but their attempt at Chana Masala with the healthy wheat roti....um no thanks.

AEaLj1mgS4Voi6yPQ4GgTw.text: Inexpensive and delicious! The restaurant itself is a no frills affair with limited seating so I do a take-out more often than not. The kati rolls consist of your choice of filling wrapped inside a 'paratha', which is a North Indian variety of bread. My usual is either the chicken tikka roll or the paneer roll. If you get 2 you get a better deal and honestly, the rolls are medium sized so one wouldn't be sufficient for most people. Just one bit of warning: the chutney/chilli mixture they use is hot. The first time I went there I made the mistake of ordering it 'hot' and after half a litre of water and some sugar, my mouth felt it may live. If you're unsure as to how hot you want the rolls to be you can always ask for the chutney on the side and it's pretty hot too. I usually ask my rolls to be 'medium' hot and still sniffle a bit at the end of the meal. Perfect take out for days with too much school work to be bothered to cook something or after an exhausting evening of shopping at oxford !Actually perfect food for any day any time! :)

8uCyi6xoRBhQ9LVsxc4XeQ.text: With the first ever YO!Sushi on the same street, perhaps Kati Roll are hoping that some of that stardust will rub off on them. It's the first London outpost of an idea that started in New York. I'm not sure whether these takeaway rolls also exist in India as my server wasn't sure.Although there is a small seating area, these rolls are designed for portability. Soft but slightly flaky paratha breads are filled with a choice of hot savoury fillings - chicken, beef and lamb for the carnivores or egg, potato and paneer for the vetetarians. This is topped with vegetables and caramelised onions and finished with a twist of lime.I really enjoyed my chicken roll. Think a fresher and lighter version of a kebab to get an idea. As Arnie said, I will be back.

APnuoojeT9ugKI875zDC5Q.text: don't understand for hight rating, food is nothing special and it's kind of dry.  Won't be back!

YkiivqxBpu2ERugQgiSWeQ.text: They take a good 20min or odd to server the Rolls which is the downside and hard to find any seating during the peak hour. otherwise its  My go to place after all the shopping around Oxford Street. The Channa rolls are my favorite. Masala chaii to wash down all the Rolls loaded with Onions and Coriander Chutney  makes it yumm...

5zw1wG0PI-EA7dsOLinGbg.text: Great food. Service is inexplicably slow. Get takeaway cos there is hardly any place to sit

N2nIk8hPkP4_hem8--P3iw.text: Since arriving in London, I have taken to using the "near me" function of the Yelp app with alarming frequency. In a city of options, one must have a tool to find the best (within the budget). So when I hit that first craving for Indian food, and happened to be in the hopping area around Oxford Circus, I decided to brave a trip to Kati Roll. Little did I know that no courage was required--the place is fantastic.The first indication of a good ethnic restaurant is the customers, and I am pleased to say that it seems a wide variety of people love Kati Roll. The tables were completely full when I walked in, with suits and locals happily munching on this new "kati roll" concept. I was able to order with my non-chip debit card, making me a happy customer, and waited patiently in the take away queue. When my food arrived, it was hot, zippy, and fresh. It made me hate to think of taking it away, and I wanted to sit down right there and eat. The idea of putting Indian food into a tortilla is brilliant, combining two of my favorite cuisines. It allows you to move in day-to-day activities while having a hand free and a hand eating. Multitasking, people! For the price, it is also very reasonable... I ordered two chicken tikka rolls, and couldn't finish.Definitely worth the little side-street you wander to find it, I look forward to introducing new London friends to Kati Roll!

UgK8nmhyIWQt0hqVekfMuw.text: Yum! If only I didn't loathe the Oxford Circus area so much... Distinctly different from Mooli's, these Kati Rolls (like small Indian burritos... sort of) are a super savoury punch of flavour and really statisfying. A small meal or subtantial snack for under £4, or a solid meal of two rolls for around £6. This franchise from NYC is definitely onto something. I went for the boring white-man option and got Chicken Tikka. And boy-oh-boy was it good. Crunchy onion pickle, the ghee-a licious soft wheat paratha (though you can get a roti, which is baked, if you prefer), tangy Chicken... just the right amount of grease to make it tasty but not greasy or heavy. The service was a bit slower than I would have liked (though it was around 12:30 on a work day), but other than that, I have no complaints and will certainly be back.

8uc1FhhCspDqK2CC8vV3fA.text: After reading all the reviews on Yelp about the Kati Roll Company, I just could not wait to try it! Tried the Beef Tikka, hmmm.....Service was slow.The wrap was way smaller than I was expecting for £3.40p.The beef was soooo tough and fatty, very disappointing, It was like chewing old leather!There was no salad or extra in the wrap - just a few pieces of fatty tough beef with a bit of red onion.So, no, was not impressed at all, I was actually disappointed;-(Moolie's is so much better. The idea of these types of places excites me! I just luv Indian food & to be able to buy a quick tasty Indian wrap is my idea of heaven! So I'm hoping they were having an off day..... I'll give them another try - in a few months....or so......On a good note: the flavours were well balanced & there was a nice amount of heat to it. So fingers crossed next time will be better!

jGTHXZs-vb_qulMu7-BAqw.text: I love this place for being unapologetically kitch and messy. Feels like a genuine street food experience.Highly recommend the masala chai!!!

tf3JJI7kX53oB28WcD2tIA.text: During my last day in London, I decided to try another Indian dish in which I was not willing to spend more than £8. Located in a side street very close to Oxford Circus, I decided to come to this place. I was not too familiar with Kati Rolls before coming so I asked the people who work there what is their most popular Kati Roll. They said to me the Unda Chicken Roll is their most popular one. I decided to get one, even though it was about £.75 more than the Chicken Tikka Roll on the menu.After waiting a few minutes, my Kati Roll came in. I sat down and began to eat it, and I thought it was one of the tastiest Indian dishes I had. Despite the greasiness, I loved the texture of the flat-bread. It was so warm, soft and chewy. As for the inside, the chicken was really tasty. Tender and meaty, with a nice flavourful spice. The vegetables inside were pretty good as well. I think one roll might be decent for a light lunch, but two of them can definitely get your stomach full. I found out that this place has another location in New York City, so I'll keep that in mind the next time I visit. Overall, this is a pretty tasty place to get some Indian take away, and I would definitely come back here again if I do not want to spend too much money while visiting Oxford Circus.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Unda Chicken Roll - 4
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Unda Chicken Roll - 4

0KiJoD1b1ThVI7CQeQQPlg.text: I'm surprised at myself for not having written a review for THIS place until now! I must've been here like a zillion times or close to almost all the time I've gone to Oxford Circus. The enthusiastic walls are done in orange with old and some loud Bollywood movie posters and they serve the BEST keema (lamb) and achari paneer (Indian cheese) wrap in London. The atmosphere perfectly translates to what I'd call 'haven' after you're down a few drinks in the pubs around the area and you do not have to be cautious while ordering here, as the wraps are a-m-a-zing and the pricing is sweet!

aO9D-jr2Gq8EJgZ9dZf3rA.text: I decided to try this place on the strength of some reviews and persuaded all my office colleagues to follow! (OK didnt really take much as they can just eat non stop..). After spending ages looking at the delicious menu online we settled on a few different ones so we could compare notes. When I got there I still had to queue to pay but got my order pretty quickly. Back in the office I was welcomed by a bunch of salivating guys, mmmm!  First of all the rolls are not that big and one wouldn't be enough to fill you for lunch, luckily we all had one and a half as we wanted to try different ones. They got the order wrong and put a couple of them in paratha rather than Roti roll but we decided to just keep them as I didnt really fancy another walk through soho at lunchtime. Spices and flavours were quite nice but all of us agreed that the meat was far too dry and quite frankly a bit of a disappointment.Maybe they just had a bad day so Im determined to give them another go at some point!

z1L11ND2gfwRZhLrXMTdLQ.text: I've had 2 different rolls from here now. The slow cooked overnight beef one which when I when it was absolutely amazing! So tender and yummy but after recommending it to a friend he said it was a bit tough. So bad batch for him I guess.The tikka roll "spicy" was the other one and yes it was as good as the first!If you order 2 it takes about 10 minutes for them to prepare on a weekday lunch. Definitely recommend!

9xcrWmPI5zOxIrlSam9sQQ.text: The lamb Kati roll was delicious and inexpensive.  I look forward to patronizing the New York locations.

zG2Vbgc3w-BRN88eF-XYgQ.text: Mmm...my unda chicken roll was stellar - delicious and unlike anything I've had before. My only mistake was ordering only one, although it's probably for the best - they are pretty filling.  I love the casual atmosphere of this place and it's not crammed with annoying oxford street shoppers miraculously. Fun music (a combination of western classical and Bollywood tunes) and great posters on the walls.

mST9_pIRNfeWQPlsA_YvTg.text: wowsa!!So cheap!! So friendly!!! so damn tasty!! exactly what you need in Soho when your on your way to a cattle market casting!! haha!! so spicy and yummy! I got the Aloo Masala Roll (spicy potato mix) which was £5 for two!!! yes two!! my friend had the other one! I can't wait to go back here and try the chicken tikka  or one of the beef ones!! This place is an absolute find for cheap lunch in Soho

Gf0m_rORBRRvCFyzhMSsKA.text: Amazing and very tasty rolls. I have had my share of rolls. These are really good. I am a veggie and generally like aloo rolls but went ahead and tried the mix veg roll. Oh my god it was delicious. Wow!!!

YkZzASCTXvHOkPC0jFM1ew.text: First time visiting London and wanted to try good Indian good on a budget. This place did the job and much more. I ordered the chicken tikka roll and the shami kebab roll, and you can't go wrong with either. The place was packed with locals so you know you're getting a great meal. Added bonus: this is quick so you can take it on the go

nrj6OkHOlKtW9zQ3hpFPgw.text: The Kati Roll Company by Lizzie GoldThe Kati Roll CompanyA place to keep good company, some might say.I love rolls, wraps and sarniesSurrounded by carbs, fillings...fill me.Take a cuisine, a curry dishWrap it in a gee fried flour and devour.Greasy fingers, greasy lipsgreasy air.I hate the smell that lingers on my clothes.Waiting, there was a lot of waiting.Waiting for food, waiting for a menu, to pay, for a table.Waiting for deliriousness.Take out, beware to stay there. Beware not to count the points in these treats if you belong to weight watchers. You'll cry.I'm crying.

6yGmakqGH8uu6dh076IYug.text: Great casual spot for a post-work munch. It's quick, cheap and tasty. i enjoyed 2 rolls! Chicken tikka & shami kabob. Chicken tikka one was better ...shami kabob one was quite dry...so ask for extra chutney/mint sauce or raita

ZIQhXeLTCQrenLnKIzw8VA.text: Lizzie G and I had a speedy lunch here last week. I was going in cold, with no idea what to expect, but she'd heard very good things...The decor? Nothing special, almost like a standard kebab shop. The menu is small but perfectly formed, and is fairly reasonable (though you could probably get a sandwich cheaper elsewhere). Yet this is hot, fresh and a little different, so worth a little bit more.I had a chicken tikka roll, and it was bliss. A fried Indian flatbread housed fresh spicy chicken with onions and lots of lovely spices. I throughly enjoyed it, despite the wait, It's obviously popular so there was a fair queue to be served - despite ordering near immediately.Bit chilly in there though, most definitely one for a take-out. And the rolls are an odd size for me. One wasn't quite enough, two probably would have been too much.I'm still a fan though, and like FJ, get a pang of craving every time I walk past!

2FUnu7H69NnGOCEnSBuPJA.text: Amazing rolls. Achari paneer roll is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Kati rolls company on poland st

Rhy729HMpB7hmaRfnDkeig.text: The concept of an Indian Burrito or wrap should seem like an obvious one, and I'm surprised I've never encountered one before london.  These Kati rolls are in the right vein, thin not-quite-naan shells with delicious meats and spices and stuff rolled all up in there. They are on the small side, but two left me slightly comatose.I tried the chicken and the lamb... both were tasty (and since I asked for it) pretty dang spicy.  My big complaint is that they were both really dry.  Some curry cream or sauce or yogourt or something would have helped the slightly parched feeling the wraps had (although the meat was very tender and flavorful.)  There is the option of adding egg, which she described as omelet, but that's not really what I mean...  I guess I'm looking for the cheese or refried beans equivalent in a burrito, the gluey mess that brings it all together and smooshes all over your mouth.So between the dryness and the very boring, garish, fast food-ey decor of the interior, it lost a few marks.  But these rolls are still worth a sample (individual rolls are nice and cheap) and are a great quick bite as you explore, so do give 'em a shot.

UdbzeQe0vWbFSFO2KnC7ag.text: This was a tasty place to stop for some good Indian snacks just off of Oxford Street. We found it by chance, but will be sure to search this out next time. It's a very humble interior, as they want you to feel like you're on the street in India, and they keep the menu pretty simple as well. We split a chicken tikka wrap, and it was enough to hold us over, but most people looked like they ordered 2 per person. It was mid afternoon, but still packed, so we enjoyed some Indian beer (brewed in the UK) and enjoyed the break from the crowd. 2 beers and a juicy wrap with tons of flavor was 11 pounds, and totally worth the money!!

UxByZrmfdiEDtpWiloQ30g.text: An excellent place for an Indian-inspired lunch, if you're feeling up for paying a little more than usual. Really tasty, moreish wraps - the chicken tikka roll is my favourite thus far, plus the coriander "chutney" goes really well! Though asking an extra 20p or so for the little tub is a bit silly - I don't see why it's not included, they have vats of the stuff! Doesn't everyone want delicious coriander dip? Just me then, I guess...I did find that one roll is not quite enough, but thankfully they price 2 (of the same) at a discounted rate, so whilst you'll be paying £7, you'll be full and very, very satisfied. Well marinaded meat, perfectly cooked - juicy with that grilled charring to add flavour - plus the usual spices and onions, all served in a tasty roti wrap.Be prepared at busy times to wait 10 minutes for you order, but then you can enjoy the old Indian movie posters and other decor with your food, or just order to go. Worth a pop in now and then - I save it for special occasions when I'm really craving Indian food during a work lunch. Definitely better than, and vastly different from, the usual surrounding cafes and delis in the area. Go for it! You'll enjoy it!

DER4-XiVXEIUVr9G9hZy6Q.text: Ok. So the food tastes nice and its kinda affordable by London standards.I've tried the tikka rolls after suggested by other Yelpers and the chicken was quite dry but it was an exceptionally busy Friday lunchtime.Ill be trying more dishes in time. In a nutshell, it's cheap Indian, spicy enough, usually with a very mixed queue and a lingering Indian smell. Oh and Bollywood posters on the walls.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Busy Friday
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom

tm5-D1BhKQ0HawoaoKGbhw.text: Dropped by for a takeaway order for dinner. The restaurant is small with self serve tables, orders are placed at the counter & your number is called when food is ready. The menu has a nice variety of kathi roll selections. This was my first time trying kathi roll & it was delicious. Spiced vegetables &/or meat wrapped in a roti (delicious thin flatbread). The number of rolls to order depends on the size of your stomach & how hungry you are. 1 roll was a good sized snack, 2 rolls is a big meal. I had the shrimp masala & chicken masala, both were tasty. The shrimp masala was about half the size of the chicken masala, less filling, but the flavor of the shrimp masala was tastier. The service here was quite slow - there was confusion at the counter that left me waiting a long time for my takeaway order. Still worth trying!

-x3BP3bJrm_acWeKXhtsgA.text: Shopping around Oxford street and looking for a quick bite to eat that doesn't have a super size option?  Kati Roll is definitely my go to place after a grueling day of shopping.  I ordered the Chicken Tikka roll and it was nearly exploding with so many spices and flavor, I certainly didn't expect it from a fast food kinda place and, it's relatively cheap. I I need to go back and try the other flavours.   Move over Chipotle!  You ain't got nothin' on Kati Roll!

R3zvSOkQJN7aAYhyipv19Q.text: Good place for a quick lunch or snack. I was very happy to see a branch in London because I love the New York one! Chai is also good ^^

Ikac-Y_GcD-SBk10DkF9UA.text: Out of the dozens of lunch spots in the area, this hits the spot serving up something a bit different. A few colleagues from work dragged me there, knowing I am a big fan of Indian food. I must admit, upon entering I rolled my eyes thinking -- oh look, tattered Bollywood posters just like somewhere in Mumbai. How quaint. Then the smell, the smell hit me....the authenticity. You know what I mean when you inhale and can taste the spices on your palate.And then I saw the price and thought: What, £4.45 for a small paneer wrap? Are you nuts? Looked like I could eat it in 2 bites.   Again I was mistaken ...if you get the wrap using paratha it is quite thick and after I was done (with only the one roll), I was pretty full! This simple paneer chili roll was amazing -- delivering complex tastes of coriander, lime, garam masala, and chili I hadn't tasted since my last trip to India. Although I was full, I was annoyed at myself for not getting the 2 rolls for £7.50.Yup, no wonder the queues are long at lunchtime.

nbvMcLYmo3ycMcVhqJY_pQ.text: Matt B loves it here so he wanted to share the love. I got a chickpea and tomato wrap and requested it "not spicy at all" since I am a spice-wimp. I liked it for the most part but it had a ton of raw onions in it, which was not my fave. The actual wrap was grilled and soft. The actual space was nice because it has a counter to order at, but there's tons of tables to sit down. We were able to take a rest from shopping on Oxford Street and get out of the cold. Next time I come, I know to just request no onions.

xhbPWnpHn9Ux3iYLQnPjYg.text: I didn't understand the excitement when my boyfriend told me I had to try this little fast food Indian roll place that had orange walls. He was as vague as that and had forgotten the name, the exact location so the image I created in my head did not do the place any justice and was off putting, The term fast food isn't the best label to put on this place but that is exactly what it is - fast Indian snack house but with quality. The place is amazing. And yes it is very orange, you pay at the counter like you would at any fast food place, collect your food and sit down to enjoy but the food you're getting is quality street food. My hopes for the place was a little better when I realised it was located in the behind Oxford Circus and Piccadilly Circus on Poland Street- the place where all the best restaurants reside in Soho and it fits in!I loved the ragged decor of old Bollywood posters plastered onto the walls half torn along with the tattered looking wooden tables and chairs. Even the air con had a quick brush of grey paint to add that to that rustic effect. It was our afternoon snack and at that time the place did seem very clean and well maintained. Staff seem friendly enough and were having their own little jokes in the kitchen which was nice to have. Music was well chosen to suit the atmosphere, not too loud and calm for one to hear each other's conversation and the place was filled with groups of friends who looked like they were after a little snack break after a long shopping trip in Oxford Street.I would advise everyone here to order the Paratha roll. It is the standard one so even if you don't specify it is the one you will get unless you request for a roti roll instead. And it is these amazing wraps that makes all the difference to these rolls. These fried seasoned flatbreads in ghee, buttery, flakey yet slightly chewy texture made it really good to bite into. They were also slightly charry which gave it that slight smokey flavour. I could have easily eaten these alone with soup but they really did play a huge part in making these rolls so deliciously satisfying. Where my boyfrend went for the Prawn Masala Roll I went for the Shami Kebab roll. I did take a bite of the Prawn Masala and found the prawns packed with flavour and very well spiced with a good kick of heat. It was very light and hollow, probably not best if you wanted something to fill you up but the flavours were immense. But it did not compare to my Shami Kebab roll which was bursting with mild spices and flavours. The croquettes had a beautifully coarse texture of the minced lambs and lentils, juicy and slightly crispy with extra flavours coming through the lovely smokey onions. I would not have changed anything about them other than the fact I wish I ordered two rather than one. For £5 they aren't cheap as a snack but people pay nearly that much for a coffee these days. But the option to order them in twos at a discounted price is cool for those who want to be filled up.I would also recommend the Mango Lassi if one is willing to pay £3 to one. It was the cherry on top of my meal- sweet, thick and creamy and everything I expect from a Mango Lassi and in a nice presentable glass bottle. I would highly recommend Kati Roll if you're around the West End and feeling peckish or for light eaters. You can order more and have a Kati feast and of course takeaway if you don't want to appear greedy. Trust me, they are worth every calorie.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Drink selection
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Ordering desk
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Cool Indian Film poster wallpaper

NQXvPLltQCVA6k9oRKNuKw.text: Amazing kati rolls. Straight off the streets of Calcutta. Nice decor. Very rustic. Music reminiscent of the 90s. Not bad for a nostalgia trip.

ZFf0N3qk-riB8Mjz_TMW4A.text: I have been here several times. Decent Indian wraps for a reasonable price. I have tried most of the vegetarian wraps here and achari paneer is the best out of all the veggie wraps. Both the paratha and roti taste nice. I prefer the roti though. I do feel the wraps are quite greasy sometimes. They also serve chai and lassi. Nice place to have a quick bite before or after shopping.

OP9d8WYmO0vh0PQv_iPAuw.text: Hells yeah.  I went in based on the strength of the Yelp reviews and wasn't disappointed.  I ordered the Unda Chicken Roll and the veggie Achari Paneer Roll.The Unda Chicken was decent tasting but dang..dat Achari Paneer Roll, tho.  The veggie roll has cheese cubes and was perfectly cooked.  It wasn't too salty but satisfied the savory craving in me.  The cheese makes it moist and chewy too.  I'm a fan.  I can see why the description on their website claims people have driven over state lines to eat their rolls.

PuwOKcmHRxNG4ECHmXnR3Q.text: Really really liked the aloo roll, great flavour. If (when) I go back I want to try the paneer option because although the chicken/egg combo is obviously to be supported (2+ proteins always a good thing) I suspect the vegetarian option will be more up my street. And there's loads more options besides, bigger choice than say Mooli's (not hating on Mooli's in any way of course). To sit in it's not particularly pleasant, they could do with some better lighting and more stable stools...overall though it's excellent value for money and good fresh food.

91zC7zGEDvAK7zEHP-xMtA.text: Delicious Indian vegetable and meat rolls served inside wholemeal wheat Roti or Paranthas. Excellent location and ambiance. You will feel like you are in a local tea shop in Mumbai. The interiors are filled with painted Indian Movie posters from the 80s and 90s. They also play good music. They serve Indian Chai and Lassi also. One bit of disappointment was that chutneys which are generally given as sides with rolls in many other places, are charged over here. Though it costs only a few pennies, I felt it was an overkill.Rolls cost a minimum of 3GBP and if bought a pair they give it for slightly less. Like what would cost you 8 pounds, might be paired for 6. If I were a student in London, I would be a regular here.

_sCx8_RVc4NTG7T9gV9h_Q.text: Who doesn't like a good kebab? Wrapping food in bread is pretty much a universally good idea, and the roti roll is not at risk of providing a counterexample.Kati Roll Company have a pretty limited selection of fillings but they combine them imaginatively, resulting in a decently full menu. Prices are reasonable.I do like this place. My usual order is a beef roll and an egg roll - decent combo if a little heavy on the onions sometimes. My main criticism is the speed of service - fair enough a lot of the food is made to order, but it's still pretty darned slow for a place that is decorated far too sparsely to make you want to hang around. Speaking of which, while I love the bollywood look the place is going for, it really could do with a sprucing up. Nothing says 'budget constraints' more than sagging picture frames!

AhQkWnhD2zVrDFdms4BrgA.text: it was good as a late night bite when everyone else in the area was closed. been a fan of kati rolls since. cash only.

15GHsSY7i8kBz3NVCCnFIA.text: I absolutely love this place, the location, the convenience, the food and everything else. I've been here a few times now and each time fall more and more in love with this place. I have bought my mother and grandmother here for lunch when we were out on our annual shopping trip. They were both so impressed with the food, the choices available and the price. Kati Roll has a very indian vibe which my grandmother said reminded her of some restaurant she went to years ago with my grandfather, so there is clearly some Indian origin or its just decorated extremely well. My mother who is so particular about eating indian food out loved these and commented on how authentic they tasted, which was surprising to me. We tried the various vegetarian rolls they had to offer and they were so well made that we finished what we ordered initially and as we were still hungry, ended up ordering more to eat in and then ordered some for take away for my father. If I am in the area, I will definitely come back and since I've bought my mother and grandmother, I will probably do a take away for them too. If your in the area and want a quick snack then come here. It is amazing!!!

17eBYzIc2bDaVjLG-oIZNQ.text: I like their rolls so much I ate there twice in one week. I think you'll enjoy it too and the interior design is worth a shout out, love the chic Bollywood posters

nQZfrZxSyUX4ID6zbcvAXw.text: Delicious and affordable rolls not too far from Piccadilly Circus. Nice seating environment and they take credit cards also. The other nice thing is that their paratha are not super oily.

vSvM8lEArIP28jTD5xImkg.text: Da best (fairly) fast-food joint in da town y'all! Its on Poland street and has a fair bit of seating room and a toilet downstairs as well - This is very important information if you have just finished a grueling multi-hour multi-point shopping spree. I found this place thanks to a random nice guy who replied to my tweet imploring the wise crowds to suggest a place to quench my thirst and hunger. The tweet travelled across the Atlantic and reached me just in time for lunch and the restaurant was conveniently found a few blocks from work! It isn't much to look at on the outside. A small shop near a big-ass pub (which by the way is full of people on Friday nights). The menu is short and is made up a few rolls with different stuff inside it - don't forget to ask for the little box of mint sauce they give away. The chai is good as well. The deco is 60-80's Indian movie posters and the style of posters that we still see in Rural India in some places where they couldn't bothered to 'print' stuff out - its all painted. The Matrix poster (called 'Mayajaal' in Hindi) is particularly funny.

yh2lSXS3bQlLMWgM1ub-xA.text: It's a nice little place, never too busy so it's ideal to pop in for a quick lunch. It is a little pricey for lunch, but hey, it's easily the best Kati roll place in the area. Maybe the only Kati roll place. Probably? Weirdly, whenever I long for my days back in NY, I head here. There was one of these a short walk from my work, and in either city it was a tasty great thing

4-5djnh0E8EK_mFuUERM3A.text: I passed this place on Poland St Soho without even a thought most days. It's hard to notice it from outside. Once inside I loved the Bollywood style Bombay Cafe wallpaper. Very cool. It's a narrow place but there was a queue already at midday (strange I thought as it was early for lunch). but a good sign.I wanted something cheap and cheerful so I could take out and wander the streets of Soho. I knew they had a variety (a very good choice) of Paratha wraps. Being Asian I've had a lot of Paratha's in my time. I really wanted to taste it without meat so I opted for the sweet potato. I actually got 2 (they have a deal on always where you can have 2 of same for slightly cheaper price).I had to wait about 20 mins. But to me this is a good sign as it was really being made fresh. I sat down and waited. The Sweet potato was worth the wait. In fact one roll was enough. It was stuffed with potato! The Paratha was very well made. I will definitely come back to have a lamb or chicken one. Maybe just one on it's own actually. At about £3.50 it was a good lunch meal in a bustling Soho scene.

Euc4mgzhoccxLaM73Ni28A.text: They wraps are a nice takeaway. Quite spicy, quite good. Don't expect something super outrageous

EWle_bO3NwzUOMgm25LEdg.text: I went there twice during my stay in London , it is in SOHO area, there decor are of old Indian movie posters, rolls are very cheep ranges about 7 to 8 pounds for two..

OtqWinuDmPcFQm7J3ggEYA.text: Roll up. Roll up. My Indian friends tell me this is more authentic than Amitabh Bachchan sipping on some Majige in Maniple. Now a lot of people tell me it's more dense at dinner time than a Delhi train station, but I've been lucky enough roll up to Kati Roll and experience it during the quieter times; so as much as I hate to let in you in on a secret as I might lose my favourite spot here, come for an early tea. It's kind of like a more fun than Subway, kind of place, considering essentially the rolls are a variation on sammiches, but in no way are these rolls sub-par, they're rather su-perb actually. This carby pit-stop is a really cheery place with jolly Bolly bangers on the playlist and the rolls are satisfying enough to see even the most peckish potential party-goer or go-home-r through the evening. The prawn wraps are my fave and the paratha roll itself is rich, fluffy and doughy with just enough ghee to get it down yer, with the cool lubricant of a chilled fizzy Cobra; Natch.One is enough for me for an early teatime fill but for a hungrier person, definitely go for the twofer offers. I'd really love it if you did, I'd ask you to get the paneer chilli roll so I could have just a little bit of a bite.

kBx1JhecmO_Hj7ukWbfTbQ.text: I loved this place since I first walked in. Masala tea was hot and delicious and so were the rolls. Prices were very reasonable too. 3 rolls and a tea was only £14. Quite a deal considering it's so close to Oxford Circus. Decor made me feel like I was in India, tons of vintage movie posters on the wall. Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Inside decor

18ogfPLBWrHXebYd0mstoA.text: Delicious and super authentic Indian street food! Tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Oxford Street and without the crazy price tag, too - a rare find in central London. I would suggest one item for a snack, two for a meal, but then I have a big appetite so plenty of people would find one enough!

5xeU0Wuf61NfxqaBPofD5A.text: This little place is great for a late night snack. It is not too expensive but a little small on the portion size. Flavours were great, place is clean, vegetarian options available. I would not go out of my way to have this but it is great to know if you are in the Oxford Street area and needed quick, hot food on the go.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Shami kabab roll

pvrNZnoTM_spsZa0BFHAug.text: Yummy paratha breads filled with a choice of different fillings - with veggie options to boot. The venue is a bit no frills, with Bollywood posters plastered on the walls. Our table was dirty - it's the kinda place you clean it yourself. It's fast food, but you do have to wait a wee while as they make your food to order. Plus you have to pay for extras like chutney (20p).The paratha was delicious, and the chicken inside was tasty but as it wasn't that hot they lose a star.

hhVGowfv_Zh6Anpezvnejw.text: Ohhh this place is just so good. Where to start...The Kati Roll Company specialises in Indian wraps (in your choice of either a paratha or roti) with delicious fillings. I'd recommend two wraps per person; one would be a snack. Now onto filings: we went for the paneer roll, the shami kebab roll (minced lamb and lentils), the unda chicken roll (chicken tikka with egg), and the shrimp masala roll, all in parathas. All excellent; the shrimp masala being my favourite with the huge tiger prawns and mix of spices. The paneer roll was much blander compared to the others because the paneer was in such large chunks. Overall, not spicy (win for me!), but a very good mix of spices to give depth to the flavours. This place has maybe 10 tables, and is more of a cafe/fast food joint than a restaurant; the food is served on paper plates, and you should make sure to clean up after yourself. It gets pretty busy but it is very much worth waiting for.

T65zdnu4EQxnDgVY84YklQ.text: Mmm my fave quickstop for food in the area, most recently when in need of a speedy dinner en route to the Shaftesbury Avenue Cineworld.I was ridin' solo this time, but bring a friend - the rolls go from good value to great value with the 2 for £8ish offers, plus you get to try more types! Alternatively no shame in just ordering yourself a big feast for one :DThe rolls are made of soft layered paratha bread (which I used to just scoff plain as a child mmm), stuffed with a filling of your choice and yummy veggies on top. For me the best one is the achaari paneer roll, probably because I've grown up loving the taste of achaar pickle having watched my grandma making it at home out of mango, lemon, chilli and spices. It's the perfect flavouring to team with the paneer (cheese). Last time I went with a fellow omnivore and had a Chicken Tikka roll each too, which was also nicely spicy and full of flavour.The crowd always seems to have an Asian majority, which makes me think I'm not the only one enjoying the flavours of 'home' in this setting. It usually takes a good 10 mins so not the fastest of fast food but oh so worth the little wait. If you have time to eat in, take a seat beneath an old bollywood poster and enjoy with a cup of masala chai.You might be able to manage two rolls; I usually manage one-and-a-half and save the rest for later - they have some useful foil-lined takeaway packets that stop the smell infiltrating your whole bag (shame they couldn't help with the smell on my tingling lips and fingers afterwards though - I rocked up at the cinema massively paranoid at being the walking cliche of an indian girl who smells like a curryhouse...!).Ok, my mouth is now watering which makes me think I must be due another hit of this deliciousness ASAP!

jcZJcni1UAL0RBShVWl3nw.text: Great Kati rolls, rude git for a cashier.Tables have food on them.The place would be good to eat at if the service wasn't so crappy.

lz6rnR7f_xFrg8gOpvqQ_Q.text: Quite a bizarre place to go to if you're use to you're traditional Indian food. Kati roll is a nice place to try some rolls with the Indian touch. You can have either rotis or parathas and they are equally as yumm.I'd say the price is quite high for the portions but the taste makes it worth.Definitely a place to keep an eye on..amazing lunches I had there!

kjXeRleO86YtlSC8KPGVwQ.text: One of my favourite haunts in London, the Kati Roll Company is situated just off Oxford Street and is far superior to the other eating spots in that area. The site is small and gets quite busy, if you want to eat in there is often a shortage of tables at peak times. I really like the Chicken Tikka wrap priced at around £3.75, there is an offer to get two but I find two wraps far too much food.

M1UzsOuLjEx9yiJn8r6ZDw.text: Extraordinarily delicious food. The paneer kathi roll is a home run. The service was a bit slow for a Sunday at 4pm and I was given a chicken when I ordered a paneer for my vegetarian friend -- she didn't end up being able to eat it and this was major faux pas in my book. Will return, but will have to double check the order before leaving.

JuRmQGEqc5JCGeX9L_urOg.text: Yum!! I dashed in here during my lunch break. Service was friendly, my order was ready in 2 minutes and the price was good- especially for this area! I had a tikka chicken roll and it was so tasty. Size wise, I was happy, but people with a bigger appetite may opt for the two roll option.

bBV6wpf8_cBnNbyvsw6Xtw.text: Walking though Soho you pass so many awesome restaurants, what makes you choose one? I had a mission to eat a rote from Kati so I turned my eyes and tried not to stray from the mission.  Arriving at Kati, the aromas of delicious savory Indian spices take over. I opted for a chicken tikka roll, and so did my husband. So much for trying multiple things! Around 4£ each and come out quick! Seems that they do a lot of carry out. This is a no frills place with paper plates and not much comfort to keep you sitting long, but if there is anything to say about the amount of patrons coming and going in the limited amount of time we were there, it was obviously very popular.  The roll (wrap) was delicious. The spices were right on with heat, flavor and the chicken was so moist and tender. My only wish was that I hadn't eaten breakfast so I could try more.

EAWYgob2JwrXh1RQTtZQjA.text: One of my favourite places to have best Kolkata Egg Rolls. This places is always full and it is quite difficult to get a place during peak hours. My favourite rolls are Anda Shaami (Egg and minced meat), Paneer (Cottage Cheese) Roll and Shrimp (with mint sauce) Roll. I love their spicy chutneys, Masala Chai and Mango Lassi. I have recommended this place to few people and they have introduced it to their friends.

nyR_K3KcKRC8moAg6omcVQ.text: Delicious. I would love to say "authentic", and caught myself realizing I have no way to compare authenticity. But it had all the right flavors, and sufficiently filling. I ordered two wraps - Chicken(with egg) and Masala Shrimp.My only disappointment was that I didn't buy more chutney sauce.

aDtQO7keVz-CppUR75n3tw.text: A tastey and filling midday snack with a masala chai! Had the tikka roll- warm, flavorful chicken rapped in a thin naan

kAOJXnlDeiuZ_qs5kN_oPg.text: Small shop right off Oxford street for a quick bite and a break from shopping - I ordered and got my food within 10 minutes!! I ordered the shami kebab (lamb) roll and unda chicken roll with a mango lassi.The drink was refreshing and the mango flavor was very sweet. But the texture was a little too thick for my liking (It reminded me of Danimals yogurt cups.) The chicken roll with beaten eggs was delicious and my favorite. The lamb roll was interesting, the herbs and spices were very unique. The rolls are extremely oily and wrapped in thin paper, which makes the oil pool at the bottom of the roll. The entire meal came out to £12! For two rolls and a lassi, definitely a reasonable price for a decent amount of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Shami kebab (left) and ubda chicken (right)

EkZXwGLbJLbyDQD85y8hfw.text: The food here is just amazing! I don't think you can go wrong with any of the items on the menu. We tried the Chicken Tikka Roll, Unda Chicken Roll and Unda Beef Roll and they were all outside of this world! So flavorful and perfect. I would not change a thing! Both the roti and paratha versions are equally good. We had the doubles of each, and the portion size was just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Unda Beef Roll in Paratha and Chicken Tikka Roll in Wheat Roti

NvqsMDaJMZ9uKqQUDBcocQ.text: This is some of the best late night eats I have ever had, and located right in the middle of Soho, it is a perfect spot to pick up a treat after enjoying your night. They serve up Indian style rolls in many delicious varieties. We tried the beef unda, chicken tikka, and veggie. We could not agree which was best, but all were spectacular.

ms6c9nsZdEKDu9dqIKbz4w.text: Walked by this place once earlier in the day and then decided to return for dinner even though we had actually tried to eat at another place nearby but couldn't get in - which turned out to be fortuitous, because Kati Roll for the WIN!  Not knowing how large the roll was, I stupidly got only one.  My husband ordered two of them.  We both got the lovely green mint chutney to go with them.  I wolfed mine down like I hadn't eaten in 3 days (because it was so delicious) and then tried to eat half of one of his.  We really should have ordered more to go, but we were tired and not thinking clearly.  The wrap was buttery with a little bit of crispiness without being dry and chewy.  I had chicken and it was simple, yet tasty.  The chutney really brought it all home.  I wish I'd ordered more of it.  It added just enough heat without being over the top.  Now that I'm back home in Seattle, I've been looking for a recipe to try to recreate these.  I can't wait to go back to London in a few months and eat there again... and again..... and again....  It's definitely cheap, cheerful and delicious fare.

JpSFpW0j6Jm9IHvISdJvOA.text: Kati Roll - cheap, delicious, a reprieve from the chaotic Oxford Street. I love the old faded Bollywood posters and the chill ambience. I first had it in NYC where Kati Roll is a late night establishment. The original location here isn't open late at night but it's the same quality food at a great price. Try the unda chicken, the beef, and the shammi kebab. Among the vegetarian options the achari paneer is good too. They even have a rewards program where you can score free rolls and if you're thrifty, buy 2 of the same rolls to get a cheaper price.

Et1GRjmzCP3CUsra96WYWA.text: Average at best; the rolls were dry; the meat wasn't well seasoned. I took a chance seeing other Indians eating, but wasn't thrilled.

io_RO1zHDiE3qHrt9cC41g.text: So tasty. I only got one roll and to-go unfortunately. I didn't know how big they would be. Get at least two. They are addicting. I scarfed down the roll in a couple minutes. Ask for extra sauce, it costs extra but it is worth it.

_q0C9i5DP0DIUFboVJsppg.text: Tucked away on Poland Street this restaurant a great ambience with walls filled with old Hindi movie posters and Indian music blaring out the speakers. I ordered the Paneer Roll which was  delicious. Not too dry and not too soggy. It could have been slightly warmer however. I think timing is everything at this place, the busier they are the fresher and warmer your meal. The seating inside is also limited and at busy times I think you will struggle to find a place to stand let alone sit. Otherwise a cute little place, ideal for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Cool poster wallpaper

wSxUkJEbMBMwyj5_8ljhJg.text: After reading and hearing about this place I was really excited to go and visit but I have to say when I went for the first time with my friend that recommended it I wasn't blown away. The decor is really cool and very on 'theme' and there's sufficient seating. We ordered 2 rolls each and a tea to have in. The food came really quickly but we had to wait 25 minutes for the tea to arrive after my friend chased them a few times. I found the rolls quite soggy and they didn't look like they had been cooked very well but somehow the flavours were still good. It was a cheap and cheerful place and I love Indian food A LOT so it was ok but definitely not a WOW for me. However, a few weeks later I was at the pub next door with my partner and it was fairly late and he really wanted some food but not in a sit down formal setting, just something quick and easy to grab. As it was next door and open until fairly late I recommended Kati Roll and we popped in to give it another go. We ordered 2 rolls each and a beer to have in quickly. I LOVED IT! PHEW! I had an egg and potato paratha roll and a prawn paratha roll both cooked beautifully and farily crispy on the outside, just the way I like it. My partner ordered the chicken tikka roll as a roti and the mince and potato one which is his favourite now. We also ordered the green chutney pots to go with it which are a perfect accompaniment and at 25p a pot an absolutely steal. My partner finished his in about 5 minutes with a big smile on his face and as we were leaving he went up to the counter to order 4 more to take away with him! We were both impressed and ever since then I've probably come back 10 times or so and every time has been exceptional. I'm so pleased I came back to give this place another go. Every time my partner knows I'm knocking about Soho I always get a text saying 'if you go past Kati Roll can you pick me up a couple please!'. Definitely a winner in our household.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Takeaway
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Egg and potato roll
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Amazing mint chutney!

qawdBo94V3brPGrES8huoQ.text: This was my first restaurant in London. I have been to the NYC one and I love their rolls. This is not very different. The taste is consistent. The spice levels are great. Here, they serve the green chutney as well !I love the egg chicken roll ! Highly recommend this place !

5zunZ3WEhc6o4W1NtXv7pA.text: Imagine a set of mini burritos only the ingredients are all Indian flavours. It's a handheld, affordable, quick food option right near Oxford street. The perfect energy boost after (or before) a long day of shopping. The ambiance is wonderfully Bollywood and rustic transporting you to a little Indian cafe. I can recommend the chicken tikka and the shami kabab rolls, though they're all delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Decor
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Decor
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Four of the tastiest Indian rolls I've ever tasted!!!

0hvr0I6rFAGUCWE48m4Vtg.text: Addicting and affordable in London proper. The staff is a little stingy with the sauce, which is phenomenal, so make sure to request extra.

EVaV7pJbVBVIFSVCNZClkw.text: Service was good and helpful at recommendations. Not a big Indian food fan however the rolls were actually tasty i would recommend the chicken Tikka roll. The chicken was cooked perfectly and not over seasoned The location is a bit small but it has a comfy vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Unda chicken roll  and chicken tikka roll
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. The inside

3ssA_-hhlcyBEAqii3i2FQ.text: Perfect little spot just off the craziness of Oxford street. I was looking for a good place for lunch, and didn't have the wi fi on, so I couldn't just use Yelp search. I am glad to find out that this place was fantastic and my fellow Yelpers back it with 4 stars rating and close to a 100 reviews.   After walking for a bit on Oxford I couldn't decide which street to turn to look for a lunch spot, but being Polish, I knew there must be something good on Poland street!   The place is small and very busy so grab an empty table while you're in line if one becomes available. The staff was very friendly and welcoming asking if that was my first time and saying that after today I will be coming there more. I decided to mix the two rolls (getting 2 is good amount for lunch). I got one chicken tikka and one with potato filling. Once ready your number is called out and you pick your order at the counter. I love roti, so wrapping delicious Indian fillings inside them is a great idea. I only wish I got some chutney to go with it. The roti is moist and the filling is quite moist, but still you need some chutney, or that Indian yogurt drink (they sell it there) to wash it down. Still- very delicious lunch. I will be coming here more indeed, if I am back near that area!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. The bill- pretty reasonable
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. One chicken one potato filling roti
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Inside looking towards the entry

QmCWeragy33mwxn9zrzaEg.text: I was left disappointed. This is just saying it mildly.I've had huge expectations for this place since I've bookmarked it years ago due to the yelpers' good reviews. However, when we turned up late in the evening we found that there were a few patrons, plenty of seats, and one person working at the till.I ordered two mint lamb wraps, they were quite tiny for the price. The wraps were reheated. Granted the fillings were great it was filled to the brim but the sort of non-fresh reheated wrap was ruining the taste. It was also very tiny so one wrap would not have fed anyone sufficiently for lunch or dinner!My companion's wrap was not hot enough and she took it back for a further reheat...mmm maybe just bad luck? I'm not sure I want to come back during lunch with the supposedly massive queues just to see whether it's really as good as other people have been saying it was!The posters on the wall were hilarious though. A bollywood version of the Matrix? Awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom

bTKoJuOIjwjQJJPkIHoHvA.text: Wow this place is delicious.  Small wraps stuffed with deliciously spiced fillings.  I got the chana masala (chickpeas), but they have a lot of both vegetarian and meat options.  The star of the show was the paratha bread though, reminds me of Chinese scallion pancakes in consistency and texture.  This is what I have been craving instead of the naan that I find overly crispy in London.  I prefer a breadier texture I guess.  This bread was chewy and fresh, better than a tortilla.  The only thing that could make this place better is if they had additional toppings to add some crunch or freshness, but it wouldn't be as authentic.  Maybe even some basmati rice or raita.  I wish we had this place in LA!Great place for a quick bite while shopping.  Get 2 for a cheaper price.  I believe the cheaper ones were 2 for 5 pounds, one for 3.75.

YLsyv61rUwxi3pevBNDdpw.text: I really like this place. It's ideal for lunch on the go, or in my case, soak up some beer at the end of a night out!I've been coming to this place, on and off now for the past few years, and it's never failed to fill me up sufficiently and in a good way. The basis on this place is simple. They offer two types of wraps, Paratha, which is their original grilled bread, or Roti, which is whole wheat roasted bread. Once you choose your bread, you have a choice of Indian fillings.I tend to go for the roti and on this visit chose the Chicken Tikka filling and it only came to £3.75. A bargain!! If their are two of you are your'e extra hungry you can get 2 for £7.00. An even bigger bargain! Think of any sort of popular curry dish, and you can you usually get it here in a wrap.The store itself is long and narrow with the serving area at the far end. It is always packed when I go, and tends to have lots of Indian customers, which to me is a good sign. Although their is seating here, I tend to get my roti, and take it with me.They also have a Swipii loyalty system. This means you can either get a free soft drink after three visits, or a free wrap after five visits.The Kati Roll Company is well situated near Oxford Circus, just off Oxford Street. If you're in the area and feeling a bit peckish, it's an ideal place to pop into and satisfy your appetite. I highly recommmend this place for a good and different take out option.

photos.caption: Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Great prices.
Photo of Kati Roll Company - London, United Kingdom. Always busy.

ONBBryZ0WzLUdJQGzvsXBQ.text: The place is small so please don't expect a very big restaurant. I would have hoped if they played hindi film music rather than western pop. It would just add to the ambience. We ordered unda shammi roll and unda tikka roll. Both were tasty. But quantity was not that great. The masala chai was very average.

P2NGM_0S_t_VOt4lXFkokA.text: To be honest, I expected good food at a busy place (as I know the New York restaurants). Ordered a beef Kati Roll. Didn't really enjoy, salty, full of spice which killed the beef inside. Very disappointed. Also the way the serve is more like on the street with paper plates.

_mct8sVEddZ0uQD85TeYLA.text: Still my favourite only thing that has changed is that they have raised their prices £6 and upwards.

axaoGWlDpxzqBq_srCUUxw.text: Good place for quick & easy food without any confuse menu simple and straightforward i tried the chicken tikka roll very testy and full of different flavor good place in soho...:)

wumgaoRTzh4byez5FREgcA.text: A friend took me there today because she loved them in New York. They were good food, but the service person was unintelligible and a little slow, and the food, while pleasantly spicy, was kinda dry. Not bad, and freshly made, and perfectly recommendable, but just not OMG I HAVE CRAVINGS NOW!I am sure it is perfectly fine when you stumble out of the King's Arms next door kinda drunk and need something to sober up a bit while trying to score at the Closing Time Sidewalk Sale so you can take a bear guy home. But walking 20 minutes for it like we did, nah.

_cP54eeDYO-DBEUzeVrJTQ.text: One of the things I miss most about London.  When I lived there, my flat was just a couple blocks away, and I'd stop at Kati Roll on the way home after work to pick up a bite.  Cheap and delicious!  The unda chicken roll (chicken tikka with egg) is pretty damn amazing, and I really really wish  there was something similar closer to home.

02wqMBL0EsW1uVkmDQmbkA.text: Great Indian kebab like rolls. OK ambience too. Nice value at about £7 for a filling feed.

rdp0NMedrbu7pMM-XeUWJA.text: A 'Kati Roll' is a type of Indian street food popular in Kolkata (Calcutta), India. Kati Roll has just three branches, two in New York (where Time Out New York lauded it in 2002 and 2005), and one in London on the fringes of Soho. The rolls available include, spicy potatoes, paneer, chicken tikka, beef or mutton. These are finished off with spices, red onion and lime slivers. The 'Kati Roll' is said to have been inadvertently created by by Nizam's, a restaurant in the city noted for its Mughlai food. Seemingly, the number of people asking for kebab and parathas one day far outstripped the number of plates available. It was decided to wrap the kebab in parathas, and in the process, this reduced the number of plates required. Hey presto! The Kati roll was born. Suffice it to say that at around £6 on average for two rolls, it represents good value for a filling lunchtime supersnack. I especially recommend the potato filling and the paneer (cheese) filling. I am told that the shami kabab is also quite something. I'll let you know when I try it next time!

SS_E7cmYGEiwyUt8EmY8Yg.text: This place rocks. I discovered it once by accident when I was on the hunt for a snack whilst out shopping. Where it really wins points with me is the fact that they have a half roll option. I'm not a fan of Slim Prets, or breadless sandwiches, but sometimes I just don't want to eat a massive amount, without feeling like I'm on a diet. The greasy nomableness of the rolls ensure that, without leaving you rolling out the shop. I've never had a sit down meal here, but during the wait I have much appreciated the bright décor with its collection of Bollywood posters. Top.

5FTTdBU_2eGSisLgckyFsg.text: I come from Calcutta, a city in Eastern India where rolls are a part of everyday life. Its the most popular street food there ... and one of the very few things about home that i really miss.I had seen Kati roll stores in New York and have been to there outlets in West Village and midtown. They were always crowded. So when they opened the store in London last year i was really excited (went there for dinner the very day i found out about its existence).They make the rolls really well ... my favourites are the egg chicken roll and the shami kabba roll. The service is very nice. They used to deliver the rolls to my office at St Paul's for lunch (well ... we almost always ordered more than 10 at a time). The veg options are also pretty good. They are a bit pricey here though, compared to their flagship stalls at NY. Something that costs $5.25 there costs £4 here. Since its located at a convenient location near Soho, i occasionally go there late at night on weekends (open till 12:30 on friday and saturday). But unfortunately i almost always find its empty. Its sad to see that London doesn't enjoy these great rolls :( ...

z4PDHzri8_VuhMvn7sF4pQ.text: This is a pretty cool little shop. Apparently, has its origins in NY. A friend brought me here, who has been to their shops in NY. According to him, this shop is not quite as good. Still, as a kind of casual Indian snack for lunch, this nice and tasty. I also think it works very well in this location. Not 100% authentic Indian touch to the food though, so I think 3 stars is a fair judgement.

XTGaKefjRRHIar9DBW4ZKA.text: My friend was raving about the New York location, so we went here for dinner. A roll, like someone else said, is essentially an Indian burrito. I got the chicken tikka roll, and it was really good. The pita/crepe outside was crispy without being burnt, which was a pleasant surprise, but the chicken inside was a little too dry. It was seasoned well, though, so I'm willing to write that off as a bad job. One roll definitely wasn't enough (I ended up going to the McDonald's down the street to finish my meal), but I guess that's why it's cheaper to get two.

dDRKtRs0J0MvJ_YaVSoFWw.text: urgh, tried it tonight and was not impressed. I had the shami roll, it was lukewarm (never a good idea with lamb) and the meat had a weird processed taste. Also there were whole spices in there, fine in rice when you can pick them out, not so great in a wrap. Biting into cardomom pods is not a pleasant experience. Also there was no heating on a freezing cold night. I won't be going back.

PVn368WVb-aC0I2dRzEyLA.text: This place rocks. I discovered it once by accident when I was on the hunt for a snack whilst out shopping. Where it really wins points with me is the fact that they have a half roll option. I'm not a fan of Slim Prets, or breadless sandwiches, but sometimes I just don't want to eat a massive amount, without feeling like I'm on a diet. The greasy nomableness of the rolls ensure that, without leaving you rolling out the shop. I've never had a sit down meal here, but during the wait I have much appreciated the bright décor with its collection of Bollywood posters. Top.
